title: Trenton Area Covid Vaccine Information - Trenton Health Team
cleaned_text: Health care experts recommend Covid-19 vaccines for EVERYONE 6 months and older, with booster shots for EVERYONE ages five and older. Federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention [guidance for youth vaccines](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/adolescents.html) No insurance, ID, citizenship status, or payment is required. Check the [Mercer County COVID-19 Vaccination Schedule](https://www.mercercounty.org/departments/division-of-public-health/coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19/covid-19-vaccination) for additional days/times/locations for your FREE vaccine and booster shot Make appointments for vaccines at [Henry J. Austin Health Center](https://henryjaustin.org/) Find FREE vaccines & booster shots in [Ewing](https://www.ewingnj.org/coronavirus) 9 am - 5 pm CURE Arena, Gate A off Broad Street 9 am - 7 pm Medical Home Pharmacy [828 N. Olden Ave](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/maps/place/Medical%2BHome%2BPharmacy/@40.2372601,-74.7496422,17z/data%3D!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89c15845027039ef:0x168f8105b799e759!8m2!3d40.2372913!4d-74.7474909&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1629472606963000&usg=AOvVaw15Zrur4zIbm6YqMeNoe7L8) 11 am - 5 pm Episcopo's Pharmacy [1125 Chambers St.](https://www.mapquest.com/us/new-jersey/episcopos-pharmacy-1025082) 4 - 7 pm Kilmer Elementary School, [1300 Stuyvesant Ave](https://www.google.com/search?q=1300+stuyvesant+avenue&oq=1300+Stuyv&aqs=chrome.0.0i512j69i57j0i512j0i22i30.4519j0j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8) 10 am - 6 pm CURE Arena Gate A off Broad Street 9 am - 7 pm Medical Home Pharmacy [828 N. Olden Ave](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/maps/place/Medical%2BHome%2BPharmacy/@40.2372601,-74.7496422,17z/data%3D!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89c15845027039ef:0x168f8105b799e759!8m2!3d40.2372913!4d-74.7474909&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1629472606963000&usg=AOvVaw15Zrur4zIbm6YqMeNoe7L8) 10 am - 5 pm Medical Home Pharmacy [828 Olden Ave](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/maps/place/Medical%2BHome%2BPharmacy/@40.2372601,-74.7496422,17z/data%3D!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89c15845027039ef:0x168f8105b799e759!8m2!3d40.2372913!4d-74.7474909&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1629472606963000&usg=AOvVaw15Zrur4zIbm6YqMeNoe7L8) |Date||Time||Location/Event||Address||P | 5+ |M phone 815-2180 or email [covidvac@trentonnj.org](javascript:smae_decode('Y292aWQxOUB0cmVudG9ubmoub3Jn');) Call 855-568-0545 or visit [covid19.nj.gov/Finder](http://covid19.nj.gov/Finder) Lost your vaccination card? Visit the [New Jersey Immunization Information System](https://njiis.nj.gov/core/web/index.html#/home) (NJIIS) or use the free Docket app available in the [App store](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/docket-organize-communicate/id1117444284) or on [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.foxhallwythe.docket.mobile) in English or Spanish. Need transportation: Medicaid clients can call 1-866-527-9933 United Way also offers information at 2-1-1 NJ Transit's VAXRIDE initiative supports New Jerseyans in their efforts to get vaccinated against COVID-19. You can find vaccination sites conveniently served by NJ TRANSIT bus, train and light rail routes. [Click here](https://www.njtransit.com/vaxride) Unable to leave home: City of Trenton Homebound Vaccination Program (609) 815-2556 or email [amthomas@trentonnj.org](javascript:smae_decode('YW10aG9tYXNAdHJlbnRvbm5qLm9yZw==');) Other Mercer County municipal contacts: Outside Trenton: Visit [https://covid19.nj.gov/faqs/nj-information/testing-and-treatment/how-can-i-get-the-covid-19-vaccine-if-im-homebound](https://covid19.nj.gov/faqs/nj-information/testing-and-treatment/how-can-i-get-the-covid-19-vaccine-if-im-homebound). Ages 65 and older: Senior hotline at 856-249-7007 from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. for help getting a vaccine. Hearing impaired: NJ Human Services' Division of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing communication card checklist to help communicate vital information before receiving the COVID-19 vaccination. To access, visit these links: [English](https://www.state.nj.us/humanservices/ddhh/assets/slices/DDHHvaccineScreening-v2-ENG.pdf) [Spanish](https://www.state.nj.us/humanservices/ddhh/assets/slices/DDHHvaccineScreening-v2-SP.pdf) Please follow the safety tips from the CDC and the NJ Department of Health to protect yourself and avoid putting your loved ones at risk. Visit the [NJDOH COVID Hub](https://covid19.nj.gov/) for the latest guidance. TrentonHealth Team, [LALDEF](https://laldef.org/), [Henry J. Austin Health Center](https://henryjaustin.org/) y [Rutgers University Institute for Health](https://ifh.rutgers.edu/highlight/the-institute-for-health-health-care-policy-and-aging-research-history-and-impact/) invita a la comunidad de Trenton a una sesión en internet de preguntas y respuestas sobre la seguridad y eficacia video of Q&A](https://youtu.be/kICIuDvSz9g) with a panel of medical experts and community leaders responding to questions from the community about the science of COVID-19 vaccines, and plans for distribution.
